headlines.headline: Steph Curry on knee injury, Porzingis trade, Warriors future
headlines.description: Steph Curry talks through his right knee injury, the Warriors' trade deadline and what Jimmy Butler's injury meant to the franchise.

headlines.headline: Windy: Ja Morant has 'negative value'
headlines.description: Brian Windhorst breaks down why teams were not willing to take a chance on Ja Morant at the trade deadline.

headlines.headline: Why James Harden's tenure -- and an era -- is over with the Clippers
headlines.description: The Harden trade was a mutual recognition as much as an admission -- that the 11-time All-Star had a better chance to win elsewhere, and a tumultuous era in LA was effectively over.

headlines.headline: NBA greats Kerr, Nash on ups and downs of owning Spanish soccer team Mallorca
headlines.description: Steve Kerr and Steve Nash own Mallorca with a former USMNT international and an ex-tennis pro. What has it taught them about sport, leadership and life?

headlines.headline: NBA trade deadline: Execs, scouts on the aftermath of a wild week
headlines.description: Tim Bontemps canvasses the league after the trade deadline's grand finale, which now sets up a fascinating summer.

headlines.headline: Houston faces Oklahoma City, looks for 4th straight road win
headlines.description: Houston Rockets (31-19, fourth in the Western Conference) vs. Oklahoma City Thunder (40-12, first in the Western Conference)

headlines.headline: Hall of Fame quarterback Sonny Jurgensen dies at 91
headlines.description: Hall of Fame quarterback Sonny Jurgensen, who has held franchise passing records for Philadelphia and Washington for more than five decades, has died at the age of 91.

headlines.headline: Stephen A.: Vikings not re-signing Sam Darnold is 'unforgivable'
headlines.description: Stephen A. Smith looks back at Minnesota's decision to not re-sign Sam Darnold, who joined Seattle and led it to Super Bowl LX.

headlines.headline: What will be the deciding factor in Super Bowl LX?
headlines.description: The “Get Up” crew discusses the intangibles for the Patriots and Seahawks that will decide who wins Super Bowl LX.

headlines.headline: Matthew Stafford wins NFL MVP in closest vote since 2003
headlines.description: Rams QB Matthew Stafford edged Drake Maye in the closest MVP vote since 2003, then closed his acceptance speech by saying he'll return to play next season.

headlines.headline: Greeny adamant Eli Manning should be a Hall of Famer
headlines.description: The "Get Up" crew weighs in on whether Eli Manning should be inducted into the Pro Football Hall of Fame.

headlines.headline: Was Stafford more deserving of MVP than Maye?
headlines.description: The "Get Up" crew debates whether Rams QB Matthew Stafford deserved to win MVP over Patriots QB Drake Maye.

headlines.headline: NHL Power Rankings: Updated 1-32 poll heading into Olympic break
headlines.description: A special set of Power Rankings as players get ready to head to the Milan Cortina Olympics.

headlines.headline: Golden Knights dominate Kings 4-1 with early scoring blitz
headlines.description: — Mark Stone had a goal and two assists and the Vegas Golden Knights took control early Thursday night by scoring four times on their first six shots for a 4-1 victory over the Los Angeles Kings.

headlines.headline: Los Angeles Kings vs. Vegas Golden Knights: Game Highlights
headlines.description: Los Angeles Kings vs. Vegas Golden Knights: Game Highlights

headlines.headline: Florida Panthers vs. Tampa Bay Lightning: Game Highlights
headlines.description: Florida Panthers vs. Tampa Bay Lightning: Game Highlights

headlines.headline: Vasilevskiy stops 33 shots, Lightning beat Panthers 6-1 in final game before break
headlines.description: — Andrei Vasilevskiy stopped 33 shots to improve to 16-0-1 in his past 17 games, helping the Tampa Bay Lightning beat the Florida Panthers 6-1 on Thursday night in the final game for both teams before the Olympic break.

headlines.headline: Tim Stutzle's goal 47 seconds into OT helps Senators beat Flyers 2-1
headlines.description: — Tim Stutzle charged past Philadelphia defenseman Travis Sanheim and scored on a back-hand shot 47 seconds into overtime Thursday night, helping the Ottawa Senators to a 2-1 victory over the struggling Flyers.
